monogr.title: Drum Beats: Walt Whitman's Civil War Boy Lovers

bibl.author: Bethuel Smith
bibl.title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 12 March 1875
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I received your letter last weakweek & was glad to hear from you I received some papers about three weaksweeks ago last summer I was in brooklyn & I hunted for you but could not find you I madmade up my mind that I would not hear from you again but I have I received your picture & I thought it too look natural it is night now & I was agoing to the village tomorrow so I thought I would write A few lines to you my helthhealth is good & so is my families I have got three boys & one girl

the way that I came to be in brooklyn I was last summer & we went to new york new jersey brooklyn port morris newark new jersey & several places but did not do any thing of worth in any of the places I talk some of canoeing this summer but don't nowknow for certain yet I watwant you to tell me where Camden is whether it is in the upper or lower part jersey or off towards newark so that if I do come down there I can find you I would like to see you verryvery much last fall I bought A small farm & paid
fifty dollars down & fifty this spring it makes pretty hard time with me this spring I am owing some debt that I dontdon't noknow whether I can pay them or not this spring one of my horses is so lame that I cantcan't work him & I have every thing to buy I have got one cow & the two sheep that is all of my stock youreyour letters was directed riteright the two firtsfirst years of my mairagemarriage my wife was sick the most of the time so it used up what money that I had then but her health has benbeen verryvery well since then

there was so much sun this winter that it has benbeen bad gittinggetting around in this part of the country the snow is about 4 featfeet deep now in the woods but not so deep in the fields I like your peacespieces in the paper verryvery much I am to pay four hundred dollars for 39 3/4 acres of land A small house & barn on it I dont nowknow as I can think of annyany more to write at present So good buybye for this time
